medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Headaches began in childhood, occurring every 1-2 weeks with associated photophobia, phonophobia, and nausea. After a head injury, headaches increased in intensity and were followed by vomiting, stupor, and muteness within 24 hours.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of frequent headaches and depression; no history of traumatic brain injury, prior CNS infections, or developmental delay.
medical_history.family_history: One son received a VP shunt for congenital aqueductal stenosis; no other family history of hydrocephalus.
